channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: John Reid puts an AI twist on empty-chair debate routine in Virginia's lieutenant governor race

item.title: The New York Times Wants An America Without Americans
item.description: America cannot survive without heritage Americans.

item.title: America Must Slash Red Tape to Make Nuclear Power Great Again
item.description: The Nuclear Regulatory Commission decisively failed under the Biden administration.

item.title: ‘I Am Not a Secret Nazi’ Is the New ‘I Am Not a Witch’
Leftists Downplay Dem’s Nazi Tattoo After Calling Hegseth’s Christian Ink ‘White Nationalist’
item.description: The media went hysterical over Pete Hegseth's Jerusalem Cross tattoo but are much less concerned about Graham Platner's Nazi symbol.

item.title: Nuking the Filibuster Would Be Political Folly
item.description: There’s no good reason to hand Democrats such a strategic and tactical win amid the shutdown.

item.title: Taxpayer-Funded Schools Can’t Prohibit Prayer And Promote Witchcraft
item.description: What looks like harmless exploration of 'different beliefs' is reprogramming the moral compass of the next generation.

item.title: Jeff Merkley's marathon speech keeps going in Senate to protest Trump's policies
item.description: Sen. Jeff Merkley's Senate floor speech broke the 21-hour mark on Wednesday afternoon.

item.title: Trump anti-DEI education compact still waiting for a 'yes' as Arizona declines, Vanderbilt dodges

item.title: Saudi crown prince scheduled to visit White House next month
item.description: President Trump is set to meet with Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman at the White House on Nov. 18, according to multiple reports.

item.title: It Was Just an Accident’s Anti-Fascist Chic
item.description: Panahi’s manipulation of liberal sentiment appeals to the Cannes culture that always rewards progressive banalities.

item.title: NATO leader Rutte says only Trump can secure Russia-Ukraine peace deal
item.description: NATO Secretary-General Mark Rutte said Wednesday that President Trump is "the only one" who can get a peace agreement between Russia and Ukraine.

item.title: No, Trump Isn’t Destroying the White House
item.description: Good grief, people. Pull yourselves together.

item.title: Democrats, Media Clutch Pearls Over President Trump’s Perfectly Above-Board Ballroom Build
item.description: The same people and publications who cheered tearing down statues are now waxing poetic about Trump building a ballroom on private dime.
